description: The major theories of personality, including those emphasizing unconscious process (especially Freud, Jung, and Adler) and those consistent with awareness (Allport, Murray, Kelly, Rogers, Maslow, Bandura, among others) are traced to their empirical origins; the current status of the theories is evaluated, and their basic assumptions about human nature are contrasted. This exploration of personality theory is guided by the general question of how much, and in what way, central aspects of human nature can be considered within the framework of natural science.
name: FOUND SCI OF PERSONS
